Generation IV.Diamond: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.
Generation IV.Pearl: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.
Generation IV.Platinum: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig , the shell should feel moist.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.

Generation V.Black: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.
Generation V.White: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.
Generation V.Black 2: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.
Generation V.White 2: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.

Generation VI.X: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
Generation VI.Y: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It undertakes photosynthesis within its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if the Pokémon is thirsty.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly damp and warm to the touch.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The shell on its back is made of soil. If the shell is moist to the touch, Turtwig is very healthy.
Generation IX.Violet: It uses its whole body to photosynthesize when exposed to sunlight. Its shell is made from hardened soil.

Generation IV.Diamond: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity
Generation IV.Pearl: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity
Generation IV.Platinum: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase on Route 201

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after entering the Hall of Fame twice
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after entering the Hall of Fame twice

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity Grand Underground - Grassland Cave , Sunlit Cavern , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity Grand Underground - Grassland Cave , Sunlit Cavern , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Crimson Mirelands : near Droning Meadow , massive mass outbreaks

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Received as an Egg from Jacq on Reveler's Road (random between Turtwig, Chimchar and Piplup) Canyon Biome , Chargestone Cavern (after boosting biodiversity in the Canyon Biome)
